radiographic_examinations.findings: Images are moderately compromised by motion. Lower Thorax: No effusion. Minimal atelectasis in the right middle lobe. Liver: 3 small benign hepatic cysts. Patent hepatic, portal veins. Mild hyperemia of the hepatic parenchyma adjacent to the gallbladder on early arterial phase images. Biliary: Innumerable small gallstones within gallbladder lumen. Suggestion of 0.3 cm stone in the very distal common bile duct. Borderline common bile duct diameter 0.7 cm. No intrahepatic bile duct dilatation. No pericholecystic fluid. Gallbladder is not dilated. Mild linear gallbladder wall enhancement, nonspecific, consider chronic or very early acute cholecystitis. Pancreas: Normal. Spleen: Normal. Adrenal Glands: Lipid rich benign 2.5 cm left adrenal adenoma. Right adrenal gland is normal. Kidneys: Multiple small bright T2 lesions in bilateral kidneys, consistent with benign cysts. 2 cm dark T2, intermediate T1 signal exophytic lesion in the upper pole of the left kidney, with minimal linear peripheral discontinuous enhancement, consistent with hemorrhagic cyst. Gastrointestinal Tract: No abnormalities. Lymph Nodes: No adenopathy. Vasculature: Patent vasculature. Osseous and Soft Tissue Structures: No abnormalities.
